title: 10 Provocations for Circular Design - Metropolis Magazine
summary: This article explores the challenges and opportunities of creating a truly circular economy in the architecture and interior design industry. It highlights the need for technological innovation in materials and processes, as well as cultural shifts in how we value used goods. The article also discusses the limitations of adaptive reuse and the importance of reducing overconsumption, advocating for less design and more thoughtful use of resources.

title: CEFLEX Teams up with Recyda to Facilitate Sustainable Design Check Tool - Packaging Strategies
summary: CEFLEX, a consortium promoting circularity in flexible packaging, has launched a free online tool called 'Design Check' to help companies assess whether their packaging designs meet the organization's guidelines for recyclability. The tool analyzes the materials and elements used in packaging, providing feedback on its compatibility with different recycling processes. This tool aims to simplify the use of CEFLEX's guidelines and help companies accelerate progress on circular design for flexible packaging.
official_company_name: CEFLEX - The Circular Economy for Flexible Packaging

greenwashing: The tool is designed to help companies create recyclable packaging, which is not inherently greenwashing as it aims to promote genuine sustainability.

title: The Story Behind Coachtopia, Coach’s New Vision for Circular Fashion - Retail TouchPoints
summary: Coachtopia, a new sub-brand from Coach, is focusing on circularity and sustainability in fashion. This brand, designed for Gen Z, prioritizes recycled and repurposed materials and embraces a community-driven approach. Coachtopia aims to scale its learnings and apply them to the larger Coach brand, ultimately transforming the fashion industry towards a more sustainable model.

title: Cisco Unveils Next-Generation Environmental Sustainability Strategy - CXOToday.com
summary: Cisco has launched "The Plan for Possible", an environmental sustainability strategy focusing on transitioning to clean energy, evolving to a circular economy, and investing in resilient ecosystems. The company is making strides with technology solutions for energy efficiency and circularity, including the Silicon One chip and the Cisco Takeback and Reuse Program. Cisco is committed to helping its supply chain reduce GHG emissions and is investing in climate solutions that help regenerate ecosystems.

title: 'Design Check' tool from CEFLEX to enable collaborative flexible packaging design - Packaging Europe
summary: CEFLEX and Recyda have developed a new ‘Design Check’ tool to help companies design more sustainable flexible packaging. The tool assesses packaging designs based on CEFLEX’s D4ACE guidelines, which aim to optimize packaging for collection, sorting, and recycling. This tool could help companies meet the requirements of the upcoming EU Packaging and Packaging Waste Regulation (PPWR) and accelerate progress on circular design in the flexible packaging market.
greenwashing: The Design Check tool is not an example of greenwashing, as it aims to help companies design truly recyclable and sustainable packaging.

title: Vivobarefoot Is Serious About Circularity and Scoring Its Environmental Impact - Footwear News
summary: Vivobarefoot, a sustainable footwear brand, is collaborating with Circ, a textile-to-textile recycling company, to create fully recyclable footwear uppers made from a single material. This innovation aims to reduce reliance on virgin materials and promote a truly circular system for footwear production. The partnership is developing a shoe called the Vivobarefoot Primus Circular, scheduled to launch in fall 2024.

title: The Nike ISPA Mindbody is Arriving Soon With Barely Volt Accents - Sole Retriever
summary: Nike's ISPA Mindbody Black Barely Volt White sneaker is a part of the ISPA Mindbody line, which utilizes recycled and discarded materials to reduce the brand's carbon footprint. This aligns with Nike's circular design philosophy, where products are designed with their end-of-life in mind, aiming to minimize environmental impact. The shoe features a unique Flyknit upper, a translucent rubber outsole, and a comfortable foam midsole, boasting a distinct black and white pattern with a barely volt accent.

greenwashing: The article does not indicate any greenwashing practices, suggesting Nike is genuinely committed to sustainable practices with the ISPA Mindbody line.
